column4: hey all...just wanted to know something.....are the settings in /proc/acpi/themal_zone/THM/ the same in all ubuntu systems or are they specific to the computer being used?
looks fairly standard, the data in the files will be different though, i guess
i think its hooking into lm_sensors, i have files in the THRM folder
do you mean and instead of or?
that will give evryone LITERALLY, full access to the file
no i meant or like if i want to enable all user to just write to a file
then add put the users that you want access in a group, then give that group ownership to the file
i dont want to limit the users to a list.isnt there a way to allow any user to write to it?
you can give group ownership to the group 'users'
how do i do that through the console...I know how to do it via gui but i want to change the ownership of multiple files
you can then run: sudo chown g+w <folder>
to keep others out you can use: sudo chown root <folder>
so its now roots but you are letting the group of users have access to the folder
if you have it attatched and run: sudo lshw -C network     you can see what chip it uses and wesearch from that
if nothing comes up, use     lsusb   you can then search for the 8 character hex code
